text: Following San Francisco, and now Santa Clara and Contra Costa counties, Alameda County is considering ending indoor dining, and Marin County expects to order an indoor dining capacity reduction next week. https://t.co/GbxHlYHFsF

name: sfchronicle
text:
Oakland Museum of California is scheduled to reopen on Nov. 27, after eight months of closure due to the coronavirus pandemic. Visitors will be able to access the three main galleries of California art, history and natural sciences on a limited schedule.

name: sfchronicle
text: Steve Sisolak, the governor of Nevada, announced Friday that he has tested positive for COVID-19. According to a statement by his office, Sisolak hasn't experienced any COVID-19-related symptoms so far and he will be isolating and monitoring his symptoms. https://t.co/DVJsA7gALW

name: sfchronicle
text: The backlog at EDD prevents many Californians from appealing denials of unemployment benefits. More than half of people who are denied unemployment win their appeals, but many aren’t getting the notice that lets them file an appeal, attorneys say. https://t.co/w4kiNA9mff https://t.co/jgdIXScvE7

name: sfchronicle
text: Appealing your California unemployment claim denial: What you need to know. Between January and September, 177,248 Californians contested the EDD's decision, and more than half won rulings in their favor. https://t.co/HBodgsn50P https://t.co/0jaEqkfB1N

name: sfchronicle
text: There should be nice weather in the Bay Area this weekend, and then a little rain is in the forecast. On Tuesday, up to an inch of rain could fall in the North Bay, and a quarter-inch to a half-inch could hit San Francisco and the rest of the Bay Area. https://t.co/0T6z8QTgFO https://t.co/X9P2QXybO4

Thousands of Trump loyalists converged to protest election results and falsely claim the vote was stolen. https://t.co/mM4YSn5GjJ https://t.co/MdlnSAC3LM

name: sfchronicle
text: Bay Area charities brace for a pandemic Thanksgiving. More people than ever will likely need a meal. More safety measures than ever will be in place. And scores of volunteers who normally pitch in on the holidays are being turned away. https://t.co/tEylKI1Y01 https://t.co/6U5Dm8CM7T

name: sfchronicle
text: Contra Costa County reported 178 new cases of coronavirus on Saturday, and San Mateo County reported 133 new cases. In both cases, the number is the second-highest new case figure for the past week. https://t.co/OCQRCWCFGF https://t.co/9pYFkTNStl

name: sfchronicle
text: A king tide will arrive in the Bay Area around 10:44 a.m. on Sunday, with a height of nearly 7 feet. That could cause minor flooding in low-lying areas.  https://t.co/vgOeTNnmha https://t.co/uTPYwIa07O
